programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Cougars are mere mortals as they visit the Horned Frogs for a Big 12 game. The former Southwest Conference rivals meet for the first time since 2012. Houston was the nation's final unbeaten team before losing to Iowa State 57-53 on Jan. 9.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 14 Bears (13-2, 2-0) draw the Bearcats (12-3, 1-1) for a Big 12 engagement from Waco, Texas. The only previous meeting between the programs took place in 1946, a 55-45 Baylor victory in Ohio. The Bears are cruising with four straight wins.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: From Centre Videotron in Quebec City.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Postseason NFL Countdown
programme.desc: A review of the NFL playoffs and a look ahead to the Super Bowl.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 11 Hokies and No. 21 Seminoles square off for an ACC showdown in the Sunshine State. Virginia Tech has won eight in a row overall, and the last two meetings by a combined 31 points after the Seminoles took 30 of the first 40 engagements.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Red-hot No. 7 LSU rolls into Alabama for an SEC engagement with Auburn. LSU ran its remarkable winning streak to 16 games with an 87-70 victory over Texas A&M on Jan. 11. Aneesah Morrow (LSU) has averaged 19.8 points across her last four games.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Women's college basketball coverage.

programme.title: 2024 Australian Open Tennis
programme.desc: From Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: Monday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Previewing the Monday Night Football matchup airing later on ESPN. Host Scott Van Pelt is joined by Ryan Clark, Robert Griffin III, Marcus Spears, Adam Schefter and Michelle Beisner-Buck as they analyze every last morsel of information pertaining to Monday night's combatants, plus discuss the latest news that developed out of Sunday's action.

programme.title: NFL Football
programme.desc: The Eagles limp into an NFC wild-card game against the Buccaneers. Philadelphia lost five of its final six contests, while Tampa Bay won five of six to claim a third-straight NFC South title. Mike Evans (TB) led the NFC with 13 receiving TDs in 2023.

programme.title: Monday Night Postgame
programme.desc: A recap of the Monday Night Football matchup with highlights, interviews and more.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Owls (8-8, 1-2 American) meet the Mean Green (9-5, 2-0) for the first time. North Texas guard Jason Edwards is enjoying life in the Mean Green's new league, as the sophomore from Atlanta averaged 27 points in wins over Wichita State and Tulane.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Bulldogs (13-3, 4-1 MVC) aim to keep their momentum as they visit the Salukis (12-4, 4-1). Drake's 89-78 victory over Indiana State on Jan. 10 created a five-way logjam atop the conference with Southern Illinois, Belmont and Murray State.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Trojans arrive in Boulder, Colo., to roam with the Buffaloes. USC has won three in a row over Colorado after sweeping last season's set of games. Senior Trojans guard Boogie Ellis totaled 35 points and eight assists in those 2022-23 victories.

programme.title: 2024 Australian Open Tennis
programme.desc: From Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

programme.desc: From Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: A look the 1972 Miami Dolphins, who 50 years ago won Super Bowl VII, completing the first and only undefeated season in NFL history.

programme.title: Marty & McGee
programme.desc: This show meets at the intersection of southern lifestyle and college football to bring viewers the latest headlines across the SEC landscape.

programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 13 Tigers (14-2, 3-0 American) streak into a road contest against the Shockers (8-7, 0-2). Memphis has won nine straight following a hard-fought 107-101 overtime victory at home over Texas-San Antonio, and six in a row versus Wichita State.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Flames continue their quest to nail down their first Conference USA victory as they visit the Bulldogs in the inaugural meeting between the programs. Louisiana Tech is off to a pristine 8-0 start at the Thomas Assembly Center this season.

programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.desc: UFC Countdown is an hour long special that airs before a UFC PayPerView match. UFC President Dana White, commentators Mike Goldberg and Joe Rogan, the fighters themselves and many other personalities.

programme.title: WWE Friday Night SmackDown
programme.desc: The biggest and baddest wrestling superstars.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Ryan Kalkbrenner and the No. 22 Bluejays host the Red Storm for a Big East game. Creighton has claimed six straight meetings. Kalkbrenner, a 7-foot-1 senior, averages 15.8 points and 7.3 rebounds per contest after totaling 42 and 21 in his last two.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: An elite tilt atop the Big Ten pits the No. 3 Hawkeyes (16-1, 5-0) against the No. 14 Hoosiers (14-1, 5-0). The sides split the season series in 2022-23, with Iowa superstar Caitlin Clark averaging 34.5 points and 9.5 assists in those contests.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Pirates meet the Bulldogs in Big East play. On Jan. 9, Seton Hall won for the sixth time in seven tries as Al-Amir Dawes' 25 points keyed a win over Georgetown. Seton Hall leads the all-time series with Butler following a season sweep in 2022-23.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The reeling Friars (11-5, 2-3 Big East) try to get right against the Musketeers (7-8, 1-3). Providence has lost three straight after St. John's secured a 75-73 win on Jan. 10. Last season, Xavier swept both meetings for the first time since 2015-16.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: From Bowlero Wauwatosa in Wauwatosa, Wis.

programme.title: Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show
programme.desc: Fort Lauderdale hosts one of the largest in-water boat shows in the world.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Longtime Big East adversaries in the No. 4 Huskies (14-2, 4-1) and Hoyas (8-8, 1-4) resume their rivalry. The programs have split 72 meetings after UConn won the last six. The Huskies ride a four-game win streak after prevailing at Xavier 80-75.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: An elite tilt atop the Big Ten pits the No. 3 Hawkeyes (16-1, 5-0) against the No. 14 Hoosiers (14-1, 5-0). The sides split the season series in 2022-23, with Iowa superstar Caitlin Clark averaging 34.5 points and 9.5 assists in those contests.

programme.title: The Carton Show
programme.desc: Craig Carton, one of New York's best-known voices, analyzes and debates the biggest headlines in sports each morning.

programme.title: Undisputed
programme.desc: A daily sports talk show hosted by Skip Bayless, where each day Skip is joined by a cast of NFL legends for passionate conversations about the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Colin Cowherd and co-host Jason McIntyre break down the biggest stories and interview the biggest guests in sports.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Nick Wright, Chris Broussard and Kevin Wildes explore and energetically advance the biggest stories in sports to start the day.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: Opinions and predictions for happenings in the NFL.

programme.title: Jackie Robinson: Get to the Bag
programme.desc: Spotlights the remarkable career of Jackie Robinson beyond baseball by blending the narrative of rapper Skyzoo and the voices of multiple generations to celebrate Robinson's extraordinary life and legacy, shedding new light on his journey.

programme.title: David Ortiz: Legend of the Fall
programme.desc: A look at baseball career and legacy of the player known as "Big Papi," from the Red Sox's three World Series titles to his Hall of Fame induction; interviews with his teammates and rivals; showcasing his intimate moments and celebrations.

programme.title: Q Ball
programme.desc: The inmates on the San Quentin Warriors basketball team search for redemption from their troubled pasts. In a place where freedom is taken away, the game provides a path forward.

programme.title: Magnify Presents: Shot in the Dark
programme.desc: Tyquone's a teenage basketball star, but beyond a championship he wants to see the world. This finds him grappling with dreams bigger than the game.

programme.title: They Fight
programme.desc: Ex-convict Walter Manigan starts an after-school boxing program to steer teens in a positive direction in a Washington, D.C., neighborhood.

programme.title: Jackie Robinson: Get to the Bag
programme.desc: Spotlights the remarkable career of Jackie Robinson beyond baseball by blending the narrative of rapper Skyzoo and the voices of multiple generations to celebrate Robinson's extraordinary life and legacy, shedding new light on his journey.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Golden Eagles resume their Big East slate by playing the Wildcats. Marquette swept the two-game set with Villanova in 2022-23 for a second straight time. Marquette's Tyler Kolek averages 13.8 points and 6.4 assists per contest this season.

programme.desc: The Pirates meet the Bulldogs in Big East play. On Jan. 9, Seton Hall won for the sixth time in seven tries as Al-Amir Dawes' 25 points keyed a win over Georgetown. Seton Hall leads the all-time series with Butler following a season sweep in 2022-23.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The reeling Friars (11-5, 2-3 Big East) try to get right against the Musketeers (7-8, 1-3). Providence has lost three straight after St. John's secured a 75-73 win on Jan. 10. Last season, Xavier swept both meetings for the first time since 2015-16.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.
